content.raw: Works for me! I just have a few nitpicks left below.
content.html: Works for me! I just have a few nitpicks left below.

content.raw: I think the bold fonts made the entire widget a bit too intense. Maybe we can try regular?
content.html: I think the bold fonts made the entire widget a bit too intense. Maybe we can try regular?

content.raw: You could increase the minimum width a bit so this can't be squished when it's the only plugin on the menu
content.html: You could increase the minimum width a bit so this can't be squished when it's the only plugin on the menu

content.raw: Just a nitpick with this variable's name. It sounds like it would be true if the node needs to be updated, but it's actually the other way around.
content.html: Just a nitpick with this variable's name. It sounds like it would be true if the node needs to be updated, but it's actually the other way around.

content.raw: Nit: "should *be*"
content.html: Nit: "should be"

content.raw: Should this be pose instead of vector?
content.html: Should this be pose instead of vector?

update.description: This PR is bringing in the align tool functionality (for Citadel, this will only incorporate the center align due to API breaking changes being required for min and max align).
update.title: Align Tool

content.raw: Hmm, I might’ve made a mistake with testing and just ensured that multiple selection from entity tree works without testing the align tool.  I just went down a rabbit hole of reducing logic and found that we can remove the `sendEvent` boolean completely and the behavior \(seemingly\) remains the same.  \(Really sorry for creating another PR, but I think it’ll be quick\) Can you look at the fix [here](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-gazebo/pull-requests/582/remove-select-entity-from-selection-helper) when you get a chance?  I think this resolves the issue without a hacky fix.
content.html: Hmm, I might’ve made a mistake with testing and just ensured that multiple selection from entity tree works without testing the align tool. I just went down a rabbit hole of reducing logic and found that we can remove the sendEvent boolean completely and the behavior (seemingly) remains the same. (Really sorry for creating another PR, but I think it’ll be quick) Can you look at the fix here when you get a chance? I think this resolves the issue without a hacky fix.

update.title: Align Tool

content.raw: I found that I couldn’t multiselect from the entity tree if the check for the control key isn’t made so I made a quick fix and inserted the check for the control button.
content.html: I found that I couldn’t multiselect from the entity tree if the check for the control key isn’t made so I made a quick fix and inserted the check for the control button.

content.raw: Just curious, why is this change needed? I experienced some weird selection behaviours on this branch, and I'm not sure if it's because of this or because I haven't tried citadel in a while.
content.html: Just curious, why is this change needed? I experienced some weird selection behaviours on this branch, and I'm not sure if it's because of this or because I haven't tried citadel in a while.

content.raw: Just checking, I think this function is only being called with `"align"`. Why not have a `OnAlign` function instead?
content.html: Just checking, I think this function is only being called with "align". Why not have a OnAlign function instead?

content.raw: I might be mistaken, but it looks like this function won't have any effect if `if (this->dataPtr->currentState == AlignState::NONE)`? Should we check for this right at the beginning to save some time here?
content.html: I might be mistaken, but it looks like this function won't have any effect if if (this->dataPtr->currentState == AlignState::NONE)? Should we check for this right at the beginning to save some time here?

content.raw:
Sorry, I deleted my previous comment by mistake :sweat_smile:

I basically said that at this point there should be an engine loaded, so we should print an error here. The same goes for `if (engine->SceneCount() == 0)` and `if (!scene->IsInitialized() || scene->VisualCount() == 0)` below.

Note that this plugin is different from `GridConfig` because `Align()` will only be called once we have a user command. While `GridConfig::LoadGrid` is called at every iteration, and may be called while `Scene3d` is still being initialized.
content.html:
Sorry, I deleted my previous comment by mistake

I basically said that at this point there should be an engine loaded, so we should print an error here. The same goes for if (engine->SceneCount() == 0) and if (!scene->IsInitialized() || scene->VisualCount() == 0) below.

Note that this plugin is different from GridConfig because Align() will only be called once we have a user command. While GridConfig::LoadGrid is called at every iteration, and may be called while Scene3d is still being initialized.

content.raw: It should be ok if there's more than one engine, right? We could just let the user know that we're using the first one and ignoring the rest.
content.html: It should be ok if there's more than one engine, right? We could just let the user know that we're using the first one and ignoring the rest.

content.raw: highlighted -> transparent
content.html: highlighted -> transparent

content.raw: It's best to include only the headers you strictly need, instead of `rendering.hh`, which includes all of Ignition Rendering.
content.html: It's best to include only the headers you strictly need, instead of rendering.hh, which includes all of Ignition Rendering.
